intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: When tomorrow comes... you have to go home, don’t you...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes... Thank you for everything, Lyon. I’ll never forget the time I spent here.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Do you think we’ll see each other again...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes, of course. My brother and you and me. We are friends, after all. Aren’t we...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Eirika... Yep, you’re right. I hope your study of the Sacred Stones is fruitful. I know you’ll use the wisdom you glean to make your people happy.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Thank you, Eirika. You know, you’re the only reason I was able to save that girl. There were times when I wanted to give up, to admit failure. But you were always there. You were always encouraging me to succeed. That’s what kept me going. I just thought of you.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Eirika... I...I’ve always... I’m sorry... Forget what I was saying. I could never be like Ephraim...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon, what do you–

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I guess this is it, Eirika. Hope to see you again someday. I’m going to focus on my work and do my best until that day. My research will progress, and my discoveries will benefit us all. One day, I will be a prince worthy of you, and I will see you again.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Don't make that face. We'll see each other again. All three of us--you, me, and Eirika.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Yeah... I know. But when we get older, when we each take the reigns of our nations, we probably won't meet again... Not like this, I mean. Not as friends.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: What's that got to do with anything? Kings are humans, too. Emperors need not be friendless, you know.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I suppose you're right. You have a knack for cutting to the heart of things. But becoming a king or an emperor is not something you can take lightly. I really don't think we'll be the same people we are right now... What if Renais or Grado went to war? What if we were forced to fight?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Don't be ridiculous. That would never happen.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: If... If it did... We'd still be friends, wouldn't we?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Even if that happens, yes. We're friends forever. Nothing can change that. You'll see.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Hm... All right, Ephraim. Then I will see you again.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: ... Eirika...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon... It is you, isn’t it, Lyon...!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Yes... But I’m... I’m almost completely gone. Before I’m lost entirely, I want to apologize. I’m sorry, Eirika. This is all my fault. I was too weak...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: You’re not to blame, Lyon. It was the Demon King. He was controlling you...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: No, that’s not true, Eirika. When the Demon King reached into me from inside the Dark Stone...When he whispered he would see all my dreams and desires made true...I...I did not reject him. In the shadows of my heart, he saw jealousy...vanity...It was my weakness that put these emotions there, allowed them to thrive.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Everyone has weaknesses, Lyon. You’re not the only one. I do. I’m sure my brother does...Don’t hate yourself for having these feelings, please.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Thank you, Eirika. You were always...so kind. The Demon King will claim my flesh as a vessel for his resurrection. Before that can happen...I want you to kill me. I’m sorry, Eirika. I’m already-

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Oh, please...Are you done turning your failings into some sad epic of personal tragedy... It’s time we started then. I have a ritual to complete...and some nuisances to kill.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Shut your mouth. I won’t allow you to desecrate Lyon’s body any further. You will not return to this world. I will stop you myself if I must.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Ah, is that so... And do you honestly think yourself capable, wench... You once prayed for this fool’s salvation. Can you bring yourself to kill him...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: I can and I will. I made a promise to Lyon, and I intend to honor it.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Lyon.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: You came after all, Ephraim. I’m glad.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Lyon. Is this... Is this my fault? Am I responsible for how much you’ve changed? I haven’t seen you for two years now... Have you..hated me that entire time?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: No, Ephraim. I was never dishonest. I liked you both. I still do. But I was envious of you, too. That’s why I...desired this. You may not believe me when I tell you this, but... Even now, after all this, I still consider you a friend.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Lyon... You know that I do, too. I spoke the truth to you... I truly thought that we would always be friends. That’s why I... I have to stop you.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Of course. I know... You are Ephraim, after all. You could do no less, my friend. Well, come then, Ephraim. Try and stop me. I will defeat you, and then I will save the people of Grado. No one... No one will stand in my way.

boss.speaker: Lyon
boss.line: Come, and face your death! I’m waiting, you miserable fool. Your corpse will make a perfect offering in my resurrection.

boss.speaker: Lyon
boss.line: I am the Demon King… I know nothing of human frailty. I am supreme…

boss.speaker: Lyon
boss.line: Where… Where did I go wrong…

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: I guess that proves it. You’re too strong, Ephraim... I’ve always... admired...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Lyon!

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: You know, Ephraim... I always wanted to be you. I wanted to be strong and handsome... With Eirika always at my side... That’s what I wanted to be. I had... I had nothing...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Don’t be ridiculous, Lyon. Who was it that taught me history? Who covered for me when I stumbled? Didn’t you see how I looked up to you? I admired your compassion, your wisdom, your thoughtfulness....

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: Oh, yeah... That seems so long ago... I did keep you out of trouble, didn’t I? Thanks for remembering. See? You’re thoughtful, too...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Lyon... Wait! Don’t close your eyes! I’m going to save you! I’ll find a way! I...

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: No, don’t... Thanks, anyway. It was all my fault... Don’t look so sad. C’mon, Ephraim, smile. Like you used to...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: ...Lyon...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: What?! This...

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Brother! Lyon’s body! It’s...

battle.speaker: Demon King
battle.line: ...The time has come... ...My resurrection is at hand...

battle.speaker: Demon King
battle.line: Heh heh...heh heh heh... Well done, Lyon. The sacrifice of your flesh and the sum of your efforts... They were all for naught. Grado’s disaster cannot be averted. My resurrection is at hand. All this time, you imagined yourself in possession of your own free will, but it was I who planted the seed from which your ambitions grew. My deceit made you my puppet, and oh, how you danced at the end of my strings. You could never have been saved. It’s a shame, isn’t it, Lyon? And now I... I am reborn.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Demon King! You are responsible for all the misery we’ve seen! Lyon... My friend... You’re the one...

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Brother... This power... It’s different.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: I know. This power is greater than anything we’ve ever faced.... But none of that matters. I’ve learned so much... My lance is stronger than ever. That thing the deceived and murdered my friend... No matter what happens, I’m going to destroy it!

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: L’Arachel! It’s time to use it. Prepare the last Sacred Stone! We have to use its power on that beast, like in the legends!

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: You must listen to me, Ephraim. The stories are true: the stone does hold the power to stop the Demon King. However, the source of its power is human will, the desire for peace within our hearts.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: In our hearts...

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Yes, that’s right. We need not pray for the Sacred Stone to aid us now. No, we need only focus ourselves and concentrate on a better future.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: I understand. Everyone! Listen to me! This is the final battle. If we can defeat this thing, it’s over. We face the king of demons, the monster that once ruled all Magvel. He’s more powerful than any one of us here. But we have something that beast will never have. We have community, friendship, love... We have all the virtues of humanity. That is our weapon. That is our strength.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Lyon!

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Be careful, Eirika!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: It’s all right. He’s Lyon. Lyon...

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: Ei...Eirika...Is...that you...

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Yes, Lyon. It’s me.

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: Eirika...You stopped me, didn’t you... I’m glad...

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Lyon...Lyon...

battle.speaker: Lyon
battle.line: Listen...Eirika... I never had the courage to tell you, but...I’ve always loved you...

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Lyon...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: What...! This...

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Brother! Lyon’s body! It’s...

battle.speaker: Demon King
battle.line: The time has come... My resurrection is at hand...

battle.speaker: Demon King
battle.line: Now, humans...Lament your fate. Weep for the dead. Despair for the living. Wail and tremble in grief. Grovel in awe and fear. I am returned.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Is...is that...the... Demon King...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Eirika.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Brother...

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Don’t be afraid, Eirika. I’m here. Our friends are here. We have the Sacred Stone, and we have each other. We will not lose. We will defeat him.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: You’re right, Brother!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: L’Arachel! It’s time. We have to use the final Sacred Stone. We must use its power against the Demon King, as in the stories of old!

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: You must listen to me, Eirika. The stories are true; the stone does hold the power to stop the Demon King. However, the source of its power is human will, the desire for peace within our hearts.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: In our hearts...

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Yes, that’s right. We need not pray for the Sacred Stones to aid us now. No, we need only focus ourselves and concentrate on a better future.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: I understand, L’Arachel. Listen, everyone. I can never repay you for all you’ve done so far. Now, please, one last time...Lend me your strength. To defeat the Demon King! To restore peace to our lands! To take the peace we all dream of and make it real!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Let’s finish this.

battle.speaker: Seth
battle.line: My only wish is to serve and protect the two of you...

battle.speaker: Franz
battle.line: There must be something that I can do!

battle.speaker: Gilliam
battle.line: We can’t let our guard down.

battle.speaker: Vanessa
battle.line: Please, let everyone come through this unscathed...

battle.speaker: Moulder
battle.line: Hm. I wonder if we can reenact the legend.

battle.speaker: Ross
battle.line: Watch with pride, Father! I’ll show you who’s the strongest!

battle.speaker: Garcia
battle.line: This may be my last battle. I’ll hold nothing back.

battle.speaker: Neimi
battle.line: I’m starting to wonder if I really should be here...

battle.speaker: Colm
battle.line: Fighting’s all well and good, but where’s all the treasure?

battle.speaker: Artur
battle.line: That’s the king of all demons... What a ferocious sight he is.

battle.speaker: Lute
battle.line: Oh, that’s the Demon King, isn’t it? Yes, I’ve read all about him.

battle.speaker: Natasha
battle.line: ...Prince Lyon.

battle.speaker: Joshua
battle.line: So, what’s Lady Luck have in store for me today?

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Is everybody ready? We’re going to win.

battle.speaker: Forde
battle.line: We’ve got to do what we can, right?

battle.speaker: Kyle
battle.line: We’re with you all the way, Prince Ephraim!

battle.speaker: Tana
battle.line: There’s nothing to fear. I’ll protect everyone!

battle.speaker: Amelia
battle.line: Gotta d-do my best. Here goes!

battle.speaker: Innes
battle.line: Bah... I am in NO way inferior to this so-called Demon King.

battle.speaker: Gerik
battle.line: Never stop fighting. Never...

battle.speaker: Tethys
battle.line: Don’t tense up! You’ll fight better if you’re relaxed.

battle.speaker: Marisa
battle.line: My blade will cut deep.

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: I, L’Arachel, strike in the name of righteousness, order, and Rausten!

battle.speaker: Dozla
battle.line: Gwah ha ha! Same goes for me!

battle.speaker: Saleh
battle.line: Hm... Can my magic prevail?

battle.speaker: Ewan
battle.line: I’ll show you all what my magic can do.

battle.speaker: Cormag
battle.line: Defeat the foe. Nothing else matters.

battle.speaker: Rennac
battle.line: Come on... You can’t be serious!

battle.speaker: Duessel
battle.line: We must be steel blades with which to pierce the enemy.

battle.speaker: Knoll
battle.line: That’s the heart of the darkness I’ve studied? It can’t be...

battle.speaker: Myrrh
battle.line: I’ll do what I can.

battle.speaker: Syrene
battle.line: I will show you honour and valour of the Frelian Pegasus Knights.

battle.speaker: Demon King
battle.line: Gaa...grrr... Abominable Sacred Stone... I will not suffer imprisonment again. How... You possess only one... Do not fool yourselves. You cannot fully imprison me... I will grind that wretched rock and your accursed bones to powder!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: There!

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: We did it. The Demon King’s soul has been bound once more. But, Eirika, it’s not over yet. The Demon King’s soul rages against its prison. We must return it to its proper place–and quickly. But first, we must defeat the Demon King’s soulless body!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: That thing...

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Uh-huh...The real battle’s just beginning. Our ancestors paid dearly for their victory. A mountain of corpses...It’s written the Demon King was surrounded by the dead before he finally fell.

battle.speaker: Seth
battle.line: We’re all prepared to do what must be done.

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: I have no desire to make any more heartbreaking sacrifices. I promised we would all return safely, and return safely we shall!

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Did we do it?

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Yes, we did it. The Demon King’s soul has been bound once more. But, Ephraim, it’s not over yet. The Demon King’s soul rages against its prison. We must return it to its proper place–and quickly. But first, we must defeat the Demon King’s soulless body!

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: That thing?

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Uh-huh... The real battle’s just beginning. Our ancestors paid dearly for their victory. A mountain of corpses... It’s written the Demon King was surrounded by the dead before he finally fell.

battle.speaker: Seth
battle.line: We are all prepared to do what must be done.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: No... I’ll do it. I have no intention of seeing anyone else die!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That’s it. It’s over, isn’t it...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Yes. Evil has been imprisoned, locked away. The legends of old have been mirrored in our actions today.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: No, we’ve done far more than the legends ever told. We’ve destroyed the Demon King’s body. He can never come back.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That’s right. And we have you all to thank for it.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: And another thing... In that ancient battle, it took the might of the five heroes to do what we did. We did not have their extraordinary power to draw upon.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No, we didn’t. We conquered darkness and restored peace to the land, thanks to you. It was because you never gave in, you never stopped fighting. None of you, not once. Thank you...

end.speaker: Syrene
end.line: This means we’ve accomplished our mission! I must relay the good news to King Hayden at once.

end.speaker: Tana
end.line: Yes. I’m sure Father will be most pleased. Brother! This means peace will be restored, doesn’t it... Shall I fly back to Frelia and let him know...

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: There’s no need to rush. I’m sure he knows. After all, we were together, and that ensured our victory.

end.speaker: Syrene
end.line: Of course, Prince Innes...

end.speaker: Moulder
end.line: Hmmm... Looks like we’re on the outside looking in, eh... Even so, the fighting’s over. And that’s something to be happy about.

end.speaker: Gilliam
end.line: Exactly.

end.speaker: Gerik
end.line: Well that took some doing, but we finally finished the job.

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: We certainly earned our pay... Please tell me we’re going to enjoy it.

end.speaker: Marisa
end.line: Let’s go home, Chief.

end.speaker: Gerik
end.line: Let’s see now... Shall we head back to Jehanna... I guess we could stop in at the guild and get our next contract, eh...

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: But the queen’s gone... I wonder what Jehanna will do now.

end.speaker: Gerik
end.line: I’m sure it’ll all work out. After all’s said and done, it’s our home. C’mon. It’s time for Gerik’s band to ride.

end.speaker: Marisa
end.line: Let’s go.

end.speaker: Joshua
end.line: ...... ...Hm... Heads. Looks like I should be getting back as well. Homecoming time...

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: It’s over, isn’t it... The demon that drove Grado to madness is dead and gone.

end.speaker: Amelia
end.line: I-I can’t believe that I was part of this whole thing...

end.speaker: Cormag
end.line: The war is over. But so much remains to be done. Our country lost this war. The road ahead will be long and hard.

end.speaker: Duessel
end.line: That’s true. And yet... It’s a road we must travel. That’s the burden survivors must shoulder.

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: Yes. And we must fulfill the dreams of Emperor Vigarde and Prince Lyon.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Dozla, Rennac. We’ve done it.

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwaa ha ha! And a job well done it was, Princess L’Arachel.

end.speaker: Rennac
end.line: Whew... It’s finally over. So it’s about time for me to...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Hold it! I gave you no orders to leave! I am the princess of Rausten, lest you forget. I have many missions yet to fulfill. Come, Dozla, Rennac. It’s time to go!

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwaa ha ha! Wait up! Let’s move, Rennac!

end.speaker: Rennac
end.line: ...Sigh.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: The darkness... It’s gone.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Yes. That’s the end.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: I guess so...

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Let’s return home, Lady Myrrh. Our friends and family will be worrying about us...

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: What... Hey, Teacher! Where are you going... Wait up. I’m coming with you.

end.speaker: Garcia
end.line: You did well, Ross. You’re a true warrior, my pride and joy.

end.speaker: Ross
end.line: But you’re still the best, Father! That’s right! My father’s the best warrior in all Magvel!

end.speaker: Colm
end.line: Bah, I’m glad everyone’s so happy, but... They’d better not forget that they won only with our help. Right, Neimi...

end.speaker: Neimi
end.line: We all worked... together. Wasn’t that great...Colm... Sniff...

end.speaker: Colm
end.line: H-hey... Don’t start crying... Please...

end.speaker: Artur
end.line: O glorious light, were you witness to our victory... The foul demon has been purged from the earth.

end.speaker: Lute
end.line: The ancient Demon King was as powerful as the scrolls described. And yet, in the end, we were able to defeat him! After all, there’s no one better than us.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Your continued safety is all that matters to me, Princess Eirika.

end.speaker: Franz
end.line: General! Princess Eirika! We can finally return to Renais, can’t we...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, we can go home. All of us unharmed...

end.speaker: Forde
end.line: Ah, I’m exhausted. I’d like nothing more than to laze about a while... Alas, we’re not going to have that opportunity, are we, Prince Ephraim...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: No. The reconstruction of Renais is going to keep us busy. Keep your strength up. I’m going to need you in the days ahead.

end.speaker: Kyle
end.line: We’ll be beside you through it all!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: All right, let’s go home. Let’s go back to the people who are waiting for us...
